channel.title: Sound Software .ac.uk - Sustainable Software for Audio and Music Research

item.title: MLSP Prizes for Reproducibility: Winners announced!
item.description:
Announcing the winners of the MLSP 2014 and SoundSoftware.ac.uk Prizes for Reproducibility in Signal Processing, organised by SoundSoftware.ac.uk in conjuction with the IEEE Signal Processing Society for the 2014 IEEE International Workshop on Machine Learning for Signal Processing.

read more
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: SoundSoftware 2014: Videos now available!
item.description:
The SoundSoftware 2014 workshop, our third annual workshop on software and data in audio and music research, was just as enjoyable as the previous two. Because so much research in this field ends up being expressed through software, a software workshop turns out to be all about the means by which research becomes useful and relevant to people other than the original researchers—fertile ground for interesting and thought-provoking talks.

The workshop videos are now available online at http://soundsoftware.ac.uk/soundsoftware2014, so if you weren't able to make it in person, catch up here!

read more
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Register now for the SoundSoftware Third Workshop!
item.description: Our third annual one-day workshop on Software and Data for Audio and Music Research takes place on the 8th of July 2014 at Queen Mary, University of London. The workshop includes talks on issues such as robust software development for audio and music research, reproducible research in general, management of research data, and open access. Read more here, clear your calendar, and register now!
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Call for Proposals: SoundSoftware 2014 Workshop on Software and Data for Audio and Music
item.description:
Do you have a story to tell about the role of software or data in audio and music research?

This one-day workshop invites speakers from across the audio and music research community in academia and industry to tell their experiences of software development, maintenance, reproducible research, research data, open access, and any other related topics.

read more
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: MLSP 2014 SoundSoftware.ac.uk Prizes for Reproducibility in Signal Processing
item.description:
The SoundSoftware Project, in collaboration with the IEEE Signal Processing Society, will be sponsoring a Prize for Reproducibility in Signal Processing for work published at the IEEE International Workshop on Machine Learning for Signal Processing (MLSP 2014).

item.description:
The 2nd Workshop on Sustainable Software for Science: Practice and Experiences (WSSSPE2) is to be held in conjunction with SC14, Sunday, 16 November 2014, New Orleans, LA, USA.

item.title: Winners of the AES53 Reproducible Research Prizes
item.description:
The SoundSoftware project this week sponsored Prizes for Reproducibility in Semantic Audio Research at the Audio Engineering Society's 53rd Conference. We're delighted to be able to announce the winners!

item.title: SoundSoftware tutorial and RR Prizes at AES53
item.description:
We'll be co-presenting the first tutorial session at the Audio Engineering Society 53rd Conference on Semantic Audio, this weekend, and awarding Reproducible Research Prizes.

item.title: SoundSoftware.ac.uk Prizes for Reproducibility in Semantic Audio Research
item.description:
The SoundSoftware Project, in collaboration with the Audio Engineering Society's 53rd Conference on Semantic Audio, will be sponsoring a Prize for Reproducible Research works in the field of Semantic Audio published at this conference.

item.dc:creator: luisf

item.title: A workshop for research software engineers
item.description:
The Software Sustainability Institute is organising a one-day workshop for research software engineers, in Oxford on 11th September 2013. If you write software for research—even if you don't think of yourself as a software engineer—this could be really interesting.

read more
